docs.summary:
A menu container is a container that holds the elements in a
 mobile menu.
description: You can add and remove elements to the container to customize your site's mobile menu.
The menu container helps mobile site visitors navigate from page to page on a mobile site and
only appears in the mobile version of your site.
With Velo, you can customize mobile menu items by changing their labels, links,
where the item opens, and if an item displays as selected. This includes using Velo
to modify mobile site menus in real time during the visitor's stay on the site.
Learn more about [adding a mobile menu container](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-about-the-mobile-menu) to your site.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the mobile menu has finished closing.

description: The `close()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
custom mobile menu's container has finished closing.

examples.title: Close a custom mobile menu and log a message when done

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the mobile menu has finished opening.

description: The `open()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
mobile menu's container has finished opening.

examples.title: Open a custom mobile menu and log a message when done
